test_cases.name: test_add_task_with_valid_input
test_cases.description: Verify that add_task successfully adds a new task with all valid fields.

test_setup.given: A valid title, description, priority, and due date are provided. The tasks list is initially empty.
test_setup.when: add_task is called with these parameters.
test_setup.then: A new task with a unique ID is returned, the task is appended to the tasks list, and the tasks file is updated.

test_cases.name: test_add_task_missing_title
test_cases.description: Verify that add_task fails when the title is missing.

test_setup.given: A description, priority, and due date are provided, but the title is missing or None.
test_setup.when: add_task is called.
test_setup.then: An error is raised or the function returns an error indicating that the title is required.

test_cases.name: test_add_task_duplicate_id_generation
test_cases.description: Ensure that add_task generates a unique ID even if existing tasks have similar IDs.

test_setup.given: The tasks list contains tasks with existing IDs.
test_setup.when: add_task is called to add a new task.
test_setup.then: The new task receives a unique ID not present in the existing tasks.

test_cases.name: test_add_task_invalid_priority
test_cases.description: Verify that add_task handles invalid priority values.

test_setup.given: A title, description, and due date are provided, but priority is outside the allowed range or not recognized.
test_setup.when: add_task is called.
test_setup.then: An error is raised or the function returns an error indicating invalid priority.

test_cases.name: test_add_task_persistence_failure
test_cases.description: Verify that add_task handles file write errors gracefully.

test_setup.given: The tasks file is read-only or the disk is full.
test_setup.when: add_task attempts to save the tasks list.
test_setup.then: An error is raised or the function returns an error indicating persistence failure. The new task is not considered added.

test_cases.name: test_add_task_with_minimal_fields
test_cases.description: Verify that add_task can add a task when only required fields are provided.

test_setup.given: Only the required fields (e.g., title) are provided, optional fields are omitted.
test_setup.when: add_task is called.
test_setup.then: A new task is created with default values for missing optional fields.

test_cases.name: test_add_task_long_title_description
test_cases.description: Verify that add_task handles very long title and description fields.

test_setup.given: A very long title and description are provided.
test_setup.when: add_task is called.
test_setup.then: The task is added successfully if within allowed limits, or an error is raised if limits are exceeded.

test_cases.name: test_add_task_invalid_due_date
test_cases.description: Verify that add_task handles invalid due date formats.

test_setup.given: A title, description, and priority are provided, but due date is in an invalid format.
test_setup.when: add_task is called.
test_setup.then: An error is raised or the function returns an error indicating invalid due date.

test_cases.name: test_add_task_empty_tasks_list
test_cases.description: Verify that add_task works when the tasks list is initially empty.

test_setup.given: The tasks list is empty.
test_setup.when: add_task is called.
test_setup.then: A new task is created with a unique ID and added as the first task.

test_cases.name: test_add_task_special_characters
test_cases.description: Verify that add_task handles special characters in title and description.

test_setup.given: Title and description contain special characters and emojis.
test_setup.when: add_task is called.
test_setup.then: The task is added successfully and special characters are preserved.

test_cases.name: test_add_task_null_fields
test_cases.description: Verify that add_task handles None/null values for optional fields.

test_setup.given: Optional fields (description, priority, due date) are None.
test_setup.when: add_task is called.
test_setup.then: The task is added with default values for those fields.

test_cases.name: test_add_task_storage_corruption
test_cases.description: Verify that add_task handles corrupted tasks storage gracefully.

test_setup.given: The tasks file contains corrupted or invalid data.
test_setup.when: add_task is called.
test_setup.then: An error is raised or the function returns an error indicating storage corruption.

test_cases.name: Update an existing task successfully
test_cases.description: Verify that updating an existing task with valid data replaces the old task and returns the updated task.

test_setup.given: A list of tasks exists with a task having id=1. New data for title, description, priority, and due date is provided.
test_setup.when: update_task is called with task_id=1 and the new data.
test_setup.then: The task with id=1 is updated with the new data, saved, and the updated task is returned.

test_cases.name: Attempt to update a non-existent task
test_cases.description: Verify that attempting to update a task with an ID that does not exist returns None.

test_setup.given: A list of tasks exists with no task having id=999.
test_setup.when: update_task is called with task_id=999 and some data.
test_setup.then: None is returned, and no tasks are modified.

test_cases.name: Update only some fields of an existing task
test_cases.description: Verify that updating only a subset of fields (e.g., just the title) updates only those fields and leaves others unchanged.

test_setup.given: A task with id=2 exists with all fields set. Only a new title is provided.
test_setup.when: update_task is called with task_id=2 and new title.
test_setup.then: The task with id=2 has its title updated, other fields remain unchanged, and the updated task is returned.

test_cases.name: Update when tasks list is empty
test_cases.description: Verify that updating a task when the tasks list is empty returns None.

test_setup.given: The tasks list is empty.
test_setup.when: update_task is called with any task_id and data.
test_setup.then: None is returned, and the tasks list remains empty.

test_cases.name: Update with invalid task_id type
test_cases.description: Verify that providing a non-integer task_id (e.g., a string) does not update any task and returns None.

test_setup.given: A list of tasks exists with integer IDs.
test_setup.when: update_task is called with task_id='abc' (string) and some data.
test_setup.then: None is returned, and no tasks are modified.

test_cases.name: Update task with boundary ID value
test_cases.description: Verify that updating a task with the lowest or highest possible valid ID works as expected.

test_setup.given: Tasks exist with id=0 and id=MAX_INT.
test_setup.when: update_task is called with task_id=0 or task_id=MAX_INT and new data.
test_setup.then: The corresponding task is updated and returned.

test_cases.name: Update with identical data (no changes)
test_cases.description: Verify that updating a task with data identical to the current values still returns the task and saves.

test_setup.given: A task with id=3 exists with specific data.
test_setup.when: update_task is called with task_id=3 and the same data.
test_setup.then: The task is returned unchanged, and the tasks list is saved.

test_cases.name: Simulate failure when saving tasks to file
test_cases.description: Verify that if saving tasks to file fails (e.g., due to IO error), the function handles the error gracefully (if implemented).

test_setup.given: A task with id=4 exists. Saving to file will raise an exception.
test_setup.when: update_task is called with task_id=4 and new data.
test_setup.then: The function raises an exception or returns an error indicator, and the tasks list may not be updated.

test_cases.name: Update task status to Completed
test_cases.description: Verify that updating a task's status to 'Completed' works and is reflected in the returned task.

test_setup.given: A task with id=5 exists with status 'Pending'.
test_setup.when: update_task is called with task_id=5 and status='Completed'.
test_setup.then: The task's status is updated to 'Completed' and the updated task is returned.

test_cases.name: Update with invalid field data
test_cases.description: Verify that providing invalid data for a field (e.g., negative priority, malformed date) is handled appropriately.

test_setup.given: A task with id=6 exists.
test_setup.when: update_task is called with task_id=6 and invalid data (e.g., priority=-1, due_date='not-a-date').
test_setup.then: The function raises a validation error or returns None, and the task is not updated.

test_cases.name: test_delete_existing_task_success
test_cases.description: Successfully deletes a task when a valid task ID is provided.

test_setup.given: A list of tasks exists, including a task with ID 5.
test_setup.when: delete_task(5) is called.
test_setup.then: The function returns True, the task with ID 5 is removed, and the updated list is saved.

test_cases.name: test_delete_nonexistent_task
test_cases.description: Attempts to delete a task with an ID that does not exist in the task list.

test_setup.given: A list of tasks exists, none with ID 99.
test_setup.when: delete_task(99) is called.
test_setup.then: The function returns False, no tasks are removed, and the list is not saved.

test_cases.name: test_delete_task_empty_list
test_cases.description: Attempts to delete a task when the task list is empty.

test_setup.given: The task list is empty.
test_setup.when: delete_task(1) is called.
test_setup.then: The function returns False, and no save operation is performed.

test_cases.name: test_delete_task_multiple_same_id
test_cases.description: Handles the case where multiple tasks have the same ID (data inconsistency).

test_setup.given: The task list contains two tasks with ID 7.
test_setup.when: delete_task(7) is called.
test_setup.then: Both tasks with ID 7 are removed, the function returns True, and the updated list is saved.

test_cases.name: test_delete_task_first_in_list
test_cases.description: Deletes the first task in the list.

test_setup.given: The task list contains tasks with IDs [1, 2, 3].
test_setup.when: delete_task(1) is called.
test_setup.then: The function returns True, task with ID 1 is removed, and the updated list is saved.

test_cases.name: test_delete_task_last_in_list
test_cases.description: Deletes the last task in the list.

test_setup.given: The task list contains tasks with IDs [1, 2, 3].
test_setup.when: delete_task(3) is called.
test_setup.then: The function returns True, task with ID 3 is removed, and the updated list is saved.

test_cases.name: test_delete_task_only_one_in_list
test_cases.description: Deletes the only task in the list, resulting in an empty list.

test_setup.given: The task list contains a single task with ID 42.
test_setup.when: delete_task(42) is called.
test_setup.then: The function returns True, the list becomes empty, and the updated list is saved.

test_cases.name: test_delete_task_invalid_id_type
test_cases.description: Handles the case where the provided ID is not an integer.

test_setup.given: The task list contains tasks with integer IDs.
test_setup.when: delete_task('abc') is called.
test_setup.then: The function returns False, no tasks are removed, and the list is not saved.

test_cases.name: test_delete_task_id_is_none
test_cases.description: Handles the case where the provided ID is None.

test_setup.given: The task list contains tasks with integer IDs.
test_setup.when: delete_task(None) is called.
test_setup.then: The function returns False, no tasks are removed, and the list is not saved.

test_cases.name: test_delete_task_save_failure
test_cases.description: Simulates a failure when saving the updated task list after deletion.

test_setup.given: A task with ID 10 exists, and the save operation will raise an exception.
test_setup.when: delete_task(10) is called.
test_setup.then: The function attempts to remove the task, but an exception is raised during save. The function should handle the exception gracefully (e.g., propagate or log error).

test_cases.name: Retrieve all tasks successfully
test_cases.description: Verify that the GET /tasks endpoint returns the complete list of tasks with all required fields.

test_setup.given: Database contains two tasks with all fields populated.
test_setup.when: A GET request is made to /tasks.
test_setup.then: The response contains both tasks with correct fields and values.

test_cases.name: Retrieve tasks when no tasks exist
test_cases.description: Verify that the endpoint returns an empty list when there are no tasks in the database.

test_setup.given: Database contains no tasks.
test_setup.when: A GET request is made to /tasks.
test_setup.then: The response is an empty JSON array.

test_cases.name: Retrieve tasks with mixed completion status
test_cases.description: Verify that the endpoint returns tasks with both 'Completed' and 'Pending' statuses.

test_setup.given: Database contains one completed and one pending task.
test_setup.when: A GET request is made to /tasks.
test_setup.then: The response contains both tasks with correct status values.

test_cases.name: Invalid method POST to /tasks
test_cases.description: Verify that sending a POST request to the GET-only /tasks endpoint returns a 405 Method Not Allowed error.

test_setup.given: API is running.
test_setup.when: A POST request is made to /tasks.
test_setup.then: The response status is 405 and contains an appropriate error message.

test_cases.name: Invalid method PUT to /tasks
test_cases.description: Verify that sending a PUT request to the GET-only /tasks endpoint returns a 405 Method Not Allowed error.

test_setup.given: API is running.
test_setup.when: A PUT request is made to /tasks.
test_setup.then: The response status is 405 and contains an appropriate error message.

test_cases.name: Invalid Accept header
test_cases.description: Verify that the endpoint returns a 406 Not Acceptable error when the Accept header requests an unsupported format.

test_setup.given: API is running.
test_setup.when: A GET request is made to /tasks with Accept: application/xml.
test_setup.then: The response status is 406 and contains an appropriate error message.

test_cases.name: Database failure when retrieving tasks
test_cases.description: Verify that the endpoint returns a 500 Internal Server Error if the database is unavailable.

test_setup.given: Database is down or unreachable.
test_setup.when: A GET request is made to /tasks.
test_setup.then: The response status is 500 and contains an appropriate error message.

test_cases.name: Retrieve a large number of tasks
test_cases.description: Verify that the endpoint can handle and return a large list of tasks (e.g., 1000 tasks).

test_setup.given: Database contains 1000 tasks.
test_setup.when: A GET request is made to /tasks.
test_setup.then: The response contains all 1000 tasks without error.

test_cases.name: Validate all required fields in response
test_cases.description: Verify that each task in the response contains all required fields: id, title, description, priority, due_date, status.

test_setup.given: Database contains at least one task with all fields populated.
test_setup.when: A GET request is made to /tasks.
test_setup.then: Each task in the response contains all required fields.

test_cases.name: Malformed URL returns 404
test_cases.description: Verify that accessing a malformed endpoint (e.g., /task instead of /tasks) returns a 404 Not Found error.

test_setup.given: API is running.
test_setup.when: A GET request is made to /task.
test_setup.then: The response status is 404 and contains an appropriate error message.

test_cases.name: Delete existing task successfully
test_cases.description: Verify that deleting an existing task returns a success message and the task is removed.

test_setup.given: A task with ID 123 exists in the database.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/123.
test_setup.then: The response status is 200 and the message confirms deletion.

test_cases.name: Delete non-existent task returns 404
test_cases.description: Verify that attempting to delete a non-existent task returns a 404 error.

test_setup.given: No task with ID 99999 exists in the database.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/99999.
test_setup.then: The response status is 404 with an appropriate error message.

test_cases.name: Delete task with invalid ID format
test_cases.description: Verify that providing an invalid task_id format returns a 422 validation error.

test_setup.given: The API expects an integer task_id.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/abc.
test_setup.then: The response status is 422 with a validation error message.

test_cases.name: Delete task with missing ID
test_cases.description: Verify that omitting the task_id in the URL returns a 404 or 405 error.

test_setup.given: The endpoint requires a task_id parameter.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/ without a task_id.
test_setup.then: The response status is 404 or 405 indicating the endpoint is not found or method not allowed.

test_cases.name: Delete task that was already deleted
test_cases.description: Verify that deleting a task that was already deleted returns a 404 error.

test_setup.given: A task with ID 124 existed but was deleted previously.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/124.
test_setup.then: The response status is 404 with an appropriate error message.

test_cases.name: Delete task without authentication
test_cases.description: Verify that deleting a task without authentication returns a 401 or 403 error if authentication is required.

test_setup.given: The API requires authentication to delete tasks.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/125 without authentication headers.
test_setup.then: The response status is 401 or 403 with an authentication error message.

test_cases.name: Delete task with boundary ID (zero)
test_cases.description: Verify that deleting a task with ID 0 returns a 404 or validation error.

test_setup.given: No task with ID 0 exists.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/0.
test_setup.then: The response status is 404 or a validation error is returned.

test_cases.name: Delete task with negative ID
test_cases.description: Verify that deleting a task with a negative ID returns a 422 validation error.

test_setup.given: The API expects a positive integer task_id.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/-1.
test_setup.then: The response status is 422 with a validation error message.

test_cases.name: Delete task with extra request body
test_cases.description: Verify that sending a DELETE request with an unnecessary body does not affect the outcome.

test_setup.given: A task with ID 126 exists.
test_setup.when: A DELETE request is sent to /tasks/126 with an extra JSON body.
test_setup.then: The response status is 200 and the task is deleted, ignoring the body.
